sn52.3:3.1: 3 On the Bank of the Sutanu
sn52.3:4.1: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī on the bank of the Sutanu.
sn52.3:4.2: Then several mendicants went up to Venerable Anuruddha,
sn52.3:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side,
sn52.3:4.6: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
sn52.3:5.1: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.3:5.3: I meditate by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.3:5.4: I meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn52.3:5.6: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.3:5.7: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.3:5.8: And it was by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I directly knew the lower realm as lower, the middle realm as middle, and the higher realm as higher.”
